intro: Oreinotinus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, delicate leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental cultivation in greenhouses and shaded gardens.
